channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in brook, 9th November
item.description:
2 double mattresses, a headboard, a window and an office chair along with other rubbish have been dumped in the brook by the footbridge behind Henley Bank High School and are causing a drainage problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Humber Place, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface erosion, 9th November
item.description:
The road outside Bishops Cottage, Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh is eroded. As well as several large, deep potholes, there are shallow potholes, surface deterioration, edge failure, cracking and rutting. It is becoming very difficult to drive on, and an increasing risk to vehicles being damaged. The road in this section requires resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous dead boughs in tree., 9th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Please clear grass cuttings from verge, 9th November
item.description:
When ubico cut the grass here, they often don't clear away the clippings and it blocks up this drain - please could you clean clippings off the grass verge so it doesn't get into the drains, thank you so much

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Paul's Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: HGV weight limits, safe crossings and speed reductions, 9th November
item.description:
Please can we have 20mph speed limits here and weight limit signs in place because the homes here have cellars and the roadways are on Victorian foundations that aren't equipped to handle HGVs or speeding cars. Motorists emerging from the Tewkesbury Road intersection tend to speed down here - there are no safe crossings and young families and people with impaired mobility live here and its a persistent speed run. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Townsend Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Persistent blockages on Townsend Street drainage, 9th November
item.description:
Hi, there were significant problems with drainage at this location during the September flash floods. Lots of leaves blow into the road from the Honeybourne Line leaving litter and debris that compounds into drainage gratings. Similarly it feels as though there is insufficient drainage mechanisms in place - the two drains get overwhelmed quickly from surface water running in from Swindon Road and along Townsend. Please would it be possible to install more drains and clean the existing ones, thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Townsend Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole cover - been here for, 9th November
item.description:
It is in the middle of the road - workmen closed the road only a few yards from it last week. It has been here for a number of months. It is dangerous, damaging cars and could result in an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycleway covered in Debris, 8th November
item.description:
Since the recent resurfacing of the B4063 between Churchdown and Cheltenham, the entire cycleway is now covered in debris. Rocks and chunks of tarmac litter the cycleway throughout, with the worst areas around Staverton Business park. Ideally the entire route needs sweeping but specific attention needs to be on the area outside Marshall Land Rover. There is also a considerable amount of glass on the route. It has been this way for almost 2 months now. It would be amazing if someone could be sent to give it a good clean, especially after the recent poor weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole forming again, 8th November
item.description:
This has been reported and 'repaired' It was repaired about a week ago and is already breaking up, it needs to be repaired properly and not just patched up. It has heavy traffic consisting of cars and lorry's as it is right next to Walls exit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
